meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, replaced by the Congolese franc in 1997.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people in the Congo used zaire to buy things.
meanings.sent2: The zaire was the main currency before the franc took over.
meanings.sent3: I found an old zaire coin in my grandfather's drawer.
meanings.sent4: Her savings dwindled down to a single zaire.
meanings.sent5: The shiny zaire caught the child's eye in the market.

meanings.definition: A former name for the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
meanings.sent1: Zaire was the name of the country before it changed to Congo.
meanings.sent2: People used to refer to the country as Zaire in the past.
meanings.sent3: I dreamt of visiting the mystical land of Zaire.
meanings.sent4: The history books are filled with tales of ancient Zaire.
meanings.sent5: The name Zaire holds a special place in African history.

meanings.definition: A river in central Africa, flowing through the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
meanings.sent1: The Zaire river is a vital waterway for the region.
meanings.sent2: Many villages rely on the Zaire for fishing and transportation.
meanings.sent3: I took a refreshing swim in the cool waters of the Zaire.
meanings.sent4: The Zaire river meanders gracefully through the lush landscape.
meanings.sent5: The wildlife along the banks of the Zaire is diverse and fascinating.
